options.label: C
options.text: The protection from both UVA and UVB rays

multiple-choice.question: Why is it essential to wear sunscreen?

options.label: A
options.text: To protect against skin cancer and premature aging

multiple-choice.question: What should you pay special attention to before prolonged sun exposure or when at the beach or among snow?
How often should you reapply sunscreen?
What should you look for when choosing a sunscreen?

options.label: A
options.text: Broad spectrum and SPF of at least 30

What is the best time to apply sunscreen?

title: The science of macaroni salad: What's in a mixture? - Josh Kurz

multiple-choice.question: What is a mixture in chemistry?

options.label: A
options.text: A mixture is a substance that is created by combining two or more substances together without changing their chemical identity.

options.label: B
options.text: A mixture is a substance that is created by changing the chemical identity of two or more substances.

options.label: C
options.text: A mixture is a substance that is created by separating two or more substances.

options.label: D
options.text: A mixture is a substance that is created by dissolving two or more substances in a solvent.

multiple-choice.question: What is a suspension in chemistry?

options.label: A
options.text: A suspension is a mixture where particles are so small that they are the actual molecules.

options.label: B
options.text: A suspension is a mixture where particles are floating around in another substance.

options.label: C
options.text: A suspension is a mixture where particles are dissolved in a solvent.

options.label: D
options.text: A suspension is a mixture where particles are not visible to the naked eye.

multiple-choice.question: What is a solution in chemistry?

options.label: A
options.text: A solution is a mixture where particles are floating around in another substance.

options.label: B
options.text: A solution is a mixture where particles are dissolved in a solvent.

options.label: C
options.text: A solution is a mixture where particles are not visible to the naked eye.

options.label: D
options.text: A solution is a mixture where particles are the actual molecules.

multiple-choice.question: What is a colloid in chemistry?

options.label: A
options.text: A colloid is a mixture where particles are so small that they are the actual molecules.

options.label: B
options.text: A colloid is a mixture where particles are floating around in another substance.

options.label: C
options.text: A colloid is a mixture where particles are dissolved in a solvent.

options.label: D
options.text: A colloid is a mixture where particles are somewhere between a suspension and a solution.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between a suspension and a solution?

options.label: A
options.text: A suspension has particles that are floating around, while a solution has particles that are dissolved in a solvent.

options.label: B
options.text: A suspension has particles that are dissolved in a solvent, while a solution has particles that are floating around.

options.label: C
options.text: A suspension has particles that are the actual molecules, while a solution has particles that are not the actual molecules.

options.label: D
options.text: A suspension has particles that are not visible to the naked eye, while a solution has particles that are visible to the naked eye.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between a colloid and a solution?

options.label: A
options.text: A colloid has particles that are floating around, while a solution has particles that are dissolved in a solvent.

options.label: B
options.text: A colloid has particles that are dissolved in a solvent, while a solution has particles that are floating around.

options.label: C
options.text: A colloid has particles that are the actual molecules, while a solution has particles that are not the actual molecules.

options.label: D
options.text: A colloid has particles that are somewhere between a suspension and a solution, while a solution has particles that are the actual molecules.

multiple-choice.question: What is the process of breaking down a mixture into its component parts called?
What is the process of breaking chemical bonds in a mixture called?
What is the main purpose of unmixing a mixture?

options.label: C
options.text: To separate the component parts of a mixture

options.label: D
options.text: To dissolve the component parts of a mixture

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between unmixing physically and unmixing chemically?

options.label: A
options.text: Unmixing physically involves breaking chemical bonds, while unmixing chemically involves separating the component parts of a mixture.

options.label: B
options.text: Unmixing physically involves separating the component parts of a mixture, while unmixing chemically involves breaking chemical bonds.

options.label: C
options.text: Unmixing physically involves dissolving the component parts of a mixture, while unmixing chemically involves creating a new mixture.

options.label: D
options.text: Unmixing physically involves creating a new mixture, while unmixing chemically involves dissolving the component parts of a mixture.
